DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor During Or After Hematopoietic Cell Collection Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the life-threatening or disabling adverse event that the donor experienced during or after the hematopoietic cell product collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor During Or After Hematopoietic Cell Collection Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Within a certain period of time or after a certain point or period in time._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: During Or After Hematopoietic Stem Cell Collection Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The act of gathering something together.:Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.

Concepts.definition: Within a certain period of time or after a certain point or period in time.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.longName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
Concepts.definition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

AlternateNames.name: Tissue Donor During Or After Hematopoietic Stem Cell Collection Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event Specify

ReferenceDocuments.name: Specify the life-threatening
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify the life-threatening complications that the donor experienced during or after the collection:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2728988
ReferenceDocuments.description: AdverseEvent > PerformedObservation > AssessedResultRelationshp > PerformedMedicalConditionResult.value WHERE AdverseEvent.severityCode = "life-threatening" AND PerformedObservation.nameCode = "assess possible adverse event" AND PerformedObservation.dateRange IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO PerformedSubstanceExtraction.dateRange
